Description:
Cannot set 0/1 as boolean parameter value in birt:param tag.

Build number:2.2.0.v20061225.

Steps to reproduce:
1. New a report with a boolean report parameter p1_b, radio button, display
text and value pairs are correct/true and wrong/false.
2. Drag the parameter to layout.
3. New a BIRT jsp file in a birt web project.
4. Input content as:
<birt:viewer id="1"
             reportDesign="param8.rptdesign" height="500" width="500">
       <birt:param name="p1_b" value="1"/>       
</birt:viewer>
<birt:report id="1"
             reportDesign="param8.rptdesign" height="500" width="500">
       <birt:param name="p1_b" value="1"/>       
</birt:report>
3. Start the server and view the jsp file.

Expected result:
Display true as value.

Actual result:
In frameset from birt:viewer, display false as value.
In preview from birt:report, display error message as "The value "1" is invalid with the type "boolean"."

Error log:
